definition: guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
ancient/old/paleo-
surname Gu
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: It can be said that Guqin players are always facing the universe.
sentences.chinese: 彈奏古琴，即是面對天地日月。

sentences.english: Objective To compare the cognitive effects of guqin music and piano music.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究古琴和鋼琴音樂對認知的影響。

sentences.english: The Guqin This is a representative instrument of traditional Chinese musical culture.
sentences.chinese: 古琴是中國傳統音樂文化中具有代表性的樂器。

sentences.english: Therefore, I firmly believe that Guqin will enjoy a bright future of development.
sentences.chinese: 我堅信古琴的發展趨勢必然是能夠發揚光大的。

sentences.english: Chinese guqin culture has a long tradition and standing.
sentences.chinese: 中國古琴文化傳統濃厚，源流悠長。

sentences.english: Our clavichord is kept in the living-room.
sentences.chinese: 我們的古琴一直放置在客廳。

sentences.english: Guqin culture always accompany with the long history of China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國悠久的歷史中，古琴音樂文化一直都摻伴左右。

sentences.english: Indeed, the guqin was the quintessential musical instrument of traditional China's educated elite.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，古琴是傳統的中國才子彈奏的樂器中的極品。

sentences.english: The Guqin is the unique national musical instrument of China. Nowadays, it is far away from the stage.
sentences.chinese: 古琴是中國特有的民族樂器，如今卻遠離舞臺。

sentences.english: Heard of Guqin version of the" water"?

definition: zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
konghou (Chinese harp)
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
erhu (Chinese 2-string fiddle)/alto fiddle/CL:把[ba3]
musical instrument/CL:件[jian4]
guqin or seven-stringed zither
bamboo flute/CL:管[guan3]
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
fiddle/violin
yangqin/dulcimer (hammered string musical instrument)
(Western) concert flute
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
